com.customlbs.library

Interface IndoorsLocationListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IndoorsError, LoadingBuildingCallback
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IndoorsLocationAdapter, UserInteractionListenerImpl

    public interface IndoorsLocationListener
extends LoadingBuildingCallback, IndoorsError
    Main interface for localization updates from the indoo.rs service. Clients may register more IndoorsLocationAdapter and listen for specific localization events.

    The general contract of this interface for calling its methods is in the following order:

    1. loadingBuilding(int) Note: This may not be called if the building is already loaded by the service.

    2. buildingLoaded(Building)

    3. Consequent calls to positionUpdated(Coordinate, int), orientationUpdated(float), changedFloor(int, String) until

    4. leftBuilding(Building)

    See Also:
    IndoorsLocationAdapter, Indoors.registerLocationListener(IndoorsLocationListener), Indoors.removeLocationListener(IndoorsLocationListener)

      • Methods inherited from interface com.customlbs.library.IndoorsError

        onError

    • Method Detail

      • loadingBuilding

        void loadingBuilding(int progress)
        Service located a building and is processing all necessary information to make it available to the client. Depending on the building this may take some time.

        After loading finished buildingLoaded(Building) will be called.

        Any errors will be reported in IndoorsError.onError(IndoorsException).

        Specified by:
        loadingBuilding in interface LoadingBuildingCallback
        Parameters:
        progress - (0 - 100)
        See Also:
        buildingLoaded(Building), IndoorsError.onError(IndoorsException)

      • buildingLoaded

        void buildingLoaded(Building building)
        Service finished processing the building and is starting to provide location updates. Any building meta data (floors, tiles, etc.) is available in the building object.

        Called after loadingBuilding(int).

        Specified by:
        buildingLoaded in interface LoadingBuildingCallback
        Parameters:
        building - a fully resolved object of the entered building
        See Also:
        positionUpdated(Coordinate, int), changedFloor(int, String), orientationUpdated(float)

      • leftBuilding

        void leftBuilding(Building building)
        Client is no longer inside the building. You can use this for reminders or other events, or you can switch to a world map (e.g. Google maps) now.
        Parameters:
        building -

      • positionUpdated

        void positionUpdated(Coordinate userPosition,
                   int accuracy)
        New user position in form of x/y/z.

        Gets called about every second.

        X and y coordinate are your position on the current floor. The coordinate origin is the top-left corner in the building. Units are millimeter. Z is the current floor level (..., -1=Sub1, 0=Ground, 1=Floor1,...). If the position can not be computed due to bad signal, one ore more of X,Y,Z will be Interger.MAX_VALUE. Building.getFloorByLevel(int).

        For example if x=1500, y=10000, z=2 you are on the second floor and 1,5m from the left-most and 10m from the top-most corner in the building map.

        Parameters:
        userPosition - current user position
        accuracy - the accuracy radius in mm
        See Also:
        Coordinate, Building.getFloorByLevel(int)

      • orientationUpdated

        void orientationUpdated(float orientation)
        Current orientation in degrees.

        For convenience the angle is relative to the building map, not relative to North. More precisely the returned value is the clockwise oriented angle on the x,y plane starting at the y-axis.

        Parameters:
        orientation - current orientation in degrees

      • changedFloor

        void changedFloor(int floorLevel,
                java.lang.String name)
        The floor has changed.

        This will be called before you receive position updates for the new floor.

        Parameters:
        floorLevel - level of the floor (..., -1=Sub1, 0=Ground, 1=Floor1,...). if the floor can temporary not be computed you get Integer.MAX_VALUE you may use this to display a warning like "low signal, computing..."
        name -
        See Also:
        positionUpdated(Coordinate, int), Building.getFloorByLevel(int)
